articles.author: Alice Clement, Brian Choo, John Long
articles.title: A 380-million-year old predatory fish from Central Australia is finally named after decades of digging - The Conversation
articles.description: For decades, the sandstone in central Australia yielded tantalising segments of some sort of fossil fish. Now, we have finally pieced together a complete picture of this remarkable species.
articles.content: More than 380 million years ago, a sleek, air-breathing predatory fish patrolled the rivers of central Australia. Today, the sediments of those rivers are outcrops of red sandstone in the remote outb… [+5598 chars]
